Name: Statue of a High Official Carrying a Sistrum
Description: The kneeling statue represents a man offering a sistrum, or rattle, which was the sacred musical instrument of the goddess Hathor. His head is covered with a headdress over his wig that reaches his shoulders. The false beard he is wearing has been broken. His skin is in folds on his stomach, a sign of wealth and high social class, which is confirmed by the perfect way the statue has been polished. Hieroglyphic text giving his name decorates his kilt.
